meanings.definition: Lack of variety or change; tedious repetition.
meanings.sent1: The monotonies of the daily routine made the days seem endless.
meanings.sent2: The monotonies of the assembly line work were mind-numbing.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the monotonies of waiting in line at the grocery store.
meanings.sent4: The monotonies of life's rhythm can sometimes lull us into a trance.
meanings.sent5: The teacher tried to break the monotonies of the class by introducing a fun activity.

meanings.sent1: The monotonies of the dripping faucet echoed in the empty house.
meanings.sent2: The monotonies of the engine hum put him to sleep on the long drive.
meanings.sent3: The monotonies of the clock ticking became the soundtrack of the room.
meanings.sent4: The monotonies of the wind howling outside added to the eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The monotonies of the rain tapping on the roof created a soothing background noise.
